title: mount: crashes with panic: send on closed channel
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Rclone mount just "stops" now and then. I see "panic: sendon closed channel" in my logs and i can't reach the mounted folder any longer.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.52.2
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
(via systemd)
```
/usr/local/bin/rclone mount \
        --allow-other \
        --dir-cache-time 1000h \
        --drive-use-trash \
        --log-file /var/log/rclone.log \
        --log-level DEBUG \
        --no-modtime \
        --poll-interval 15s \
        --rc \
        --rc-addr :5573 \
        --drive-use-trash \
        --uid=1000 \
        --gid=1000 \
        --stats=0 \
        crypt:/ /mnt/rclone
```
